title: R44945
content: The Office of Personnel Management (OPM) has issued guidance for federal executive branch departments and agencies on HRM flexibilities for emergency situations since 2001, including after 9/11, Hurricanes Katrina and Rita, and the pandemic influenza strategy. The most recent guidance was issued in 2017 for Hurricane Harvey. OPM established an emergency leave transfer program for federal employees affected by Hurricane Harvey in 2017. They also authorized departments to hire individuals for recovery efforts after Hurricane Irma. FEBs are available to assist agencies with emergency operations. The Federal Executive Boards (FEBs) were established by a presidential memorandum issued by President John F. Kennedy in November 1961 to coordinate Federal activities at the regional level. FEBs operate in 28 metropolitan areas and aim to promote collaboration on emergency readiness and recovery among Federal agencies. Table 1 outlines flexibilities related to staffing, compensation, leave transfer, and telework in Title 5 of the United States Code and Title 5 of the Code of Federal Regulations. Positions in the Senior Executive Service (SES) require open competition based on job-related criteria. Excepted service positions are not in the competitive service or SES and have agency-specific qualification standards. SES positions are above grade 15 of the General Schedule and are not filled by presidential appointment. The Reemployment Priority List is used by agencies to consider reemployment for current and former competitive service employees separated by reduction in force or fully recovered from a compensable injury after more than one year.
